intro: Ceratostema cutucuense, commonly known as the Cutucu bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that consists of a capsule containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
